result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie D Fields

records.addlTxt: No consumption or possession of alcohol, must submit a sample of breath of blood to law enforcement upon request to determine the amount of alcohol in defendant's system.

02:21 PM Defendant Willie D Fields in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Willie D Fields in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joy appears via Zoom video. State calls Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:22 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper idntification of the defendant (2:26 PM). Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for JT, if resolved, contact JA for PLEAS. Joy - wants to address bond on both cases. Court will hear argument for bond from parties. Court reviews both files for the bond, $10,000.00 cash on 22CF29 and $1500.00 cash on 22CF24. Joy - bond - asks for total bond of $6,000.00 cash for stated reasons. State - bond - leaves up to Court. Court - bond - 22CF29 - amends bond to $6,000.00 cash and continues bond on 24CF24 - no consumption or possession of alcohol, must submit a sample of breath of blood to law enforcement upon request to determine the amount of alcohol in defendant's system.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000558,
Payable Number: 48570,
Receipt Number: 22R 000913,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:09 PM Defendant Willie D Fields appears by video from FC jail with attorney Jeffery Joy also appearing by video. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF24 and 22CF29. Joy has went over complaint in each case and asks for PH, would like within 10 days. Court will have both cases scheduled for PH. Clerk ask for time limits to be extended one day. Court confirms with Joy. Joy willing to waive time limits by one day. Court schedules both cases for PH on 4/11/22 at 2:00 PM. Continues bond in both cases and can address if needed at ARGN. Joy agrees.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Not called on the record, cases 22CF24 and 22CF29. Defendant was previously in the process of retaining Attorney Joy. State indicated Joy was going to try to appear today, but was busy in another court. Court will have rescheduled when Joy is available.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:56 AM Defendant Willie D Fields in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie D Fields appeared by video means. Court reviews file, asks if he contacted SPD. Fields states that he thought Attorney Joy was going to be here today. State has heard from Attorney Joy - working on a notice of retainer/sign paperwork. Court will set at a later time when Attorney Joy is here this afternoon. Court confirms off the record with Attorney Joy that they Joy is working on the paperwork for Fields and Court will set both those matters (22CF24 and 22CF29) to AIA on 3/30/22 at 2:30 PM when Joy is here on other mattres, continues bond on both cases.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:41 AM Defendant Willie D Fields in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie D Fields appeared by video means from FOSO. Fields does have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Fields understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has not contacted SPD. Court directs to contact SPD and to continue calling them until he gets  hold of him, reminds him of his other options. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 3/23/22 at 10:00 AM, confirms address. Fields asks for a bond reduction. State - bond - objects and asks Court to keep bond the same. Court asks questions of the defendant. Court asks State for defendant's criminal history. State responds. Court - bond - continues bond at this point for stated reasons and can address that when counsel is hired.
